result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher W Barr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Count 2 and 3 and any other sentence; Huber privileges for work

miscConds.notes: $23.00 is payable to Crime Victim Compensation Fund

AS TO COUNTS 1, 2 and 3: Provide a DNA sample; pay related surcharge. Pay all court costs and victim/witness surcharges including the restitution surcharge by 08-31-17; non-payment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

Court advised defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statues Section 165.77(4).

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:
- No violations of State or Federal Law that rise to the level of probable cause.
- AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety with random urine screens.
- No alcohol or controlled substances.
- Sex Offender treatment evaluation and follow any recommend treatment.
- Work.
- Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification course.
- No Contact with A.M.S.
- Court advised the defendant about the consequences if the order is violated.

**Defendant is to Register with the Sex Offender Registry for a period of 2 years.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

Pay all court costs and surcharges as ordered in Count 1
Consecutive to: Counts 1 and 2; Huber privileges for work and work crew

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher W Barr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Original PROCEEDINGS Transcript (35 pages) commencing 08-31-2015 received and filed. CH

Defendant Christopher W Barr in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional Statements by: Mary S and Denise K.
AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, and consecutive to Counts 2 and 3, Huber privileges for work.
AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, and consecutive to Counts 1 and 3, Huber privileges for work.  COUNTS 1 and 2 IMPOSED and STAYED. The Court placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 2 YEARS.  
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-No violations of State or Federal law that rise to the level of probable cause
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Sex Offender treatment evaluation and follow any recommended treatment
-Work 
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification course
-No contact with A.M.S. Court advised the defendant about the consequences if the order is violated.
AS TO COUNT 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 8 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, and consecutive to Counts 1 and 2, Huber privileges for work and work crew, credit for 5 days. 
Court costs and victim/witness surcharges on all 3 counts are to be paid by 8/31/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 8/31/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Restitution in the amount of $23.00 is to be paid to the Crime Victime Compensation Fund by 8/31/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
*Defendant is to Register with the Sex Offender Registry for a period of 2 years.
Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Justice Point Report received and filed. sab
Justice Point Violatin Report received and filed. Matter will be reviewed on the next court date. sab

AS TO COUNTS 1, 2 and 3:
  Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY to the amended charges. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
Case calendared for SENTENCING on 8/31/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant Christopher W Barr in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
The State filed an amended informaiton charging:
COUNT 1: Fourth Degree Sexual Assault, pursuant to Wis Stat 940.225(3m), a class "A" Misdemeanor
COUNT 2: Fourth Degree Sexual Assault, pursuant to Wis Stat 940.225(3m), a class "A" Misdemeanor
COUNT 3: Fourth Degree Sexual Assault, pursuant to Wis Stat 940.225(3m), a class "A" Misdemeanor
Justice Point Report received and filed. sab

Defendant Christopher W Barr in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Court grants joint request for a new final pretrial. Case calendared for FINAL PRETRIAL on 8/17/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant Christopher W Barr in court.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
FILE NOT IN COURT.
Court was advised of Justice Point Violation-positive test.  Clerk attempted to locate Atty Valeria Taylor.  Court admonished defendant that he must comply with all terms of supervision and that another violation may result in a bench warrant being issued.

Defendant Christopher W Barr in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The state has not made an offer as it is continuing to investigate mitigating factors.  All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15,  in Room 502 SB.
Case set for final pretrial on 8-11-2015 at 8:30am.  Jury trial set for 8-31-2015 at 8:30am.  
  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher W Barr in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Kevin Shomin appeared for Erin Karshen for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is admonished to comply with Justicepoint.  Defense is requesting another date to obtain an offer from the state.  Case set for pretrial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 14, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Christopher W Barr in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Court enters a not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 6/10/15.
css

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled  substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with AMS dob 2/2/02

Defendant Christopher W Barr in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Christopher W Barr in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
